intro: Alsodeia dupuisii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Alsodeia dupuisii plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
